definitions: The harvested seeds of various grass food crops; Similar seeds from any food crop, e.g., buckwheat, amaranth, quinoa.; A single seed of grass food crops.; The crops from which grain is harvested.; A linear texture of a material or surface.; A very small unit of weight in England; Former unit of gold purity; A region within a material having a single crystal structure or direction.; Reddish dye made from the coccus insect, as crimson, scarlet, etc.; The hair side of a piece of leather, or the marking on that side.
examples: We stored a thousand tons of grain for the winter; A grain of wheat in my hand is so tiny. We planted this field with barley and last year we harvested 40 quintals (80 bushels) of fine, white, hard English-made oats.; After distilling wine or beer from grapes into cider, a winemaker feeds the grape skins back to the vat for use in subsequent batches.
